problem:
VSd = random.randrange(300,500,5) VS = float(VSd)
RSd = random.choice([820,1000,1200]) RS = float(RSd)
Cu = random.choice([270,330,390,470]) C = float(Cu)*1e-6
RLd = 10 RL = float(RLd)
tau1 = RS*C t1 = random.choice([0.4,0.5,0.6,0.7,0.8,0.9,1.0]) vct1 = VS*(1-math.exp(-t1/tau1)) erst1 = -(tau1/2)*(VS**2/RS)*(math.exp(-2*t1/tau1) - 1) ect1 = (C/2)*vct1**2
irlt1 = vct1/RL
dt = random.choice([.01,.02,.03])
tau2 = RL*C t2 = t1+dt vlt2 = vct1*math.exp(-(t2-t1)/tau2)
In this circuit, \(V_S = $VSd\)V, \(R_S = $RSd\Omega\), \(C = $Cu\mu\)F, and \(R_L = $RLd\Omega\). The switch has been in the position shown for a very long time.
At \(t=0\) the switch is flipped to the left.
What is the voltage on the capacitor at \(t=$t1\), in Volts?
What is the energy stored in the capacitor at \(t=$t1\) seconds, in Joules?
How much energy was dissipated in the resistor \(R_S\) between \(t=0\) and \(t=$t1\), in Joules?
At \(t=$t1\) the switch is flipped to the right.
Just after the flip, what is the current through the resistor \(R_L\), in Amperes?
What is the voltage \(v_L\), in Volts, at time \(t=$t2\) seconds?
